data.title: Does unity only support ogg as live video to play?
data.meta_description:
Can i use another video stream format? 
such as flv or something else? 
any solution will be appreciated 
thanks a lot
data.text:
Can i use another video stream format?

such as flv or something else?

any solution will be appreciated

thanks a lot

Follow up question to this Ogg topic.

Could someone suggest a solid tool for creating ogg files (vorbis theora in same ogg file) that work properly for streaming in Unity (free or commercial).

I tried “MediaCoder” (free → http://www.mediacoderhq.com/) which looked good in theory, but found it buggy, unreliable and ultimately to unstable to be useful (although being in development it’s hopefully getting better).

Alternativley, suggest another route to success

Could other fileformats be used for streaming sound?

Thanx in advance

/eX

Someone in Unity Dev team:

Since you natively support ogg for streaming I’m assuming you have a suggested workflow for creating streaming media files that contain both video (theora) and sound (vorbis or speex). I could really use some suggestions for a tested and working workflow. Thanx

/eX

it does not natively support streaming I think

ogg theora just happens to be both a fixed file and a stream file format.

but you will realize that various common handles cease to work with streaming as there is no file size thus no progress for example and things like that.

When I’m in the position to create any kind of video streaming my first stop is always the same, VLC actually.

I’ve not tested it with unity as I have no need for video streaming, only used it for web located movie files.

But to be on the sure side: you have it completely implemented for usage as found in the example at ScriptReference - WWW.movie?

Including the audioclip assignement

Thanx Dreamora, VLC did actually support conversion to ogg with Theora AND Vorbis

When trying to convert from a WMV I got choppy results, but then I tired another from uncompressed QT and I got good results.

Thanx again. Ironic, I use VLC for playback but didn’t realize I could use it for conversion

/eX

If you want to request it as feature, don’t go to the thread, as thats a bit of useless. Instead check out feedback.unity3d.com if the ticket already exists, if not, add it
